text:
Hi, good morning,
I have a question about the HubSpot API. I would like to query a list of contacts with updated_at date bigger than a certain data, so that I can get only the updated records. Does anyone know how to do this?

Hi <@U049VV8CSKA>, if you look in the API doc (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>) you’ll see there’s a search endpoint that lets you filter and sort results (including some LT, GT filters). I’m pretty sure you could work something out from this.
<@U048UPEK92R>, would using GraphQL help in this instance?
<@UBT0AHWLD> sorry I have no idea as I’ve never used GraphQL.
ok

hi folks! :wave-yeti: is there a way to clone the production environment and set it as a staging or development env. the reason for asking is i've been enriching HubSpot with data from our product db, and i'd like to test my updates with an environment as close as the production. my current workflow is to export-import data manually or sometimes create dummy data just to mimic the prod env. this can be a time-consuming task and a loose representation of prod. any recommendations are appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi all – I’ve got a problem combining *srcset* and *webp*. As I see it, it’s either the one, or the other. When using ‘resize_image_url’ and thereby making my image scalable, it looks to disable the webp functionality.

Anyone has experiences with this, or knows a workaround?
Thanks a lot!
Make sure you're casting the owner ID, even if you have to do something stupid like `${parseInt(hs_owner_id}}` that might solve it
or `${hs_owner_id.toString()}`
<@U01QVR44MEY> found the solution, as usual :joy:
Sender info never gets automatically set using the API, you need to set them manually in the API call...
ahhhh interesting
This link may help if you still need support Stefano: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/create-pages-in-multiple-languages>
Is the HubSpot Themes Challenge will happen again in 2022-2023 ? anyone knows ?
they mentioned during HubSpot.Extend() conference there wouldn't be one for 2022 since the year was almost over (the last one was 2021) and no update on 2023

Hi everyone!
I have a super quick question.
I’m trying to create a support ticket via the API, and I need to associate it to a contact for our support team, but `hs_created_by_user_id` is a read only property.
Is there a way around this?
(I am using the ruby gem for this)
If this is the wrong channel, do let me know where to re-post this question
That created by user isn't the correct property, it's actually going to be HubSpot_owner_id

<@U01QVR44MEY>, sorry, maybe I need to clarify.
The `HubSpot_owner_id` would associate it to someone on our support team, which isn’t what I’m looking for.

I need to associate it with the customer that is submitting the support ticket.
You'd need to query the contacts database for that users ID unless you're storing it server side already
I’m storing it server side already
Then just use the associations api
I'll get you the url one moment
`/crm/v4/objects/contacts/{contactId}/associations/tickets/ticketid`
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
That seems like it’ll work. Thank you Carter.
Of course, let me know if you need help setting up the request
Just thought i’d circle back and thank you again Carter, I got it done earlier. I would’ve never looked for an associations API.
For sure, let me know if you run into any issues in the future
